revision.text:
<includeonly>{{location map+
| {{{1|World}}}
| border = {{{border|}}}
| alt = {{{alt|}}}
| caption_undefined = {{#ifeq: {{{caption|+}}} | {{{caption|-}}} || defined }}
| caption = {{{caption|}}}
| label = {{{label|}}}
| float = {{{float|}}}
| width = {{{width|}}}
| relief= {{{relief|}}}
| AlternativeMap = {{{AlternativeMap|}}}
| overlay_image = {{{overlay_image|}}}
| places = {{Location map~
  | {{{1|World}}}
  | label = {{{label|}}}
  | label_size = {{{label_size|}}}
  | label_width = {{{label_width|}}}
  | mark = {{{mark|}}}
  | marksize = {{{marksize|}}}
  | alt = {{{alt|}}}
  | position = {{{position|}}}
  | background = {{{background|}}}
  | link = {{{link|}}}
  | lat_dir = {{{lat_dir|}}}
  | lat_deg = {{{lat_deg|}}}
  | lat_min = {{{lat_min|}}}
  | lat_sec = {{{lat_sec|}}}
  | lon_deg = {{{lon_deg|}}}
  | lon_min = {{{lon_min|}}}
  | lon_sec = {{{lon_sec|}}}
  | lon_dir = {{{lon_dir|}}}
  | lat = {{{lat|}}}
  | long = {{{long|}}}
  }}
}}</includeonly><noinclude>{{documentation}}</noinclude>

{{documentation subpage}} This template generates a location map as a [[m:Help:composite images|composite image]] consisting of a map and a location mark. Optionally a label and caption can be added. == Usage == Map image files are not accessed directly but by using an auxiliary map definition template. For example, if the first unnamed parameter supplied to this template is "Japan", then this template uses the auxiliary template, {{Location map Japan}} which contains the data needed to generate the composite image. ;Please note: * Assigning any value to the parameter caption causes the map to be displayed as a thumbnail image. If this parameter is not declared, the template will generate a default caption. * The coordinates are not checked. If the coordinates specified fall outside the area covered by the map image, the location mark will not display inside the image, however, it may be displayed somewhere else on the page. * Do not use '''px'''. Using width=200px will usually cause a very large map to be displayed. Use width=200. * To create a map with more than one location mark use {{tl|Location map+}}. == Blank templates == {{Location map | USA relief | width = 320 | lat = 44.6 | long = -110.5 | caption = Location of Yellowstone in the north western United States }} {| ! Decimal degrees ! ! Degrees, minutes, seconds |- | style="vertical-align:top;" | 
{{Location map
| {{{1}}}
| width      = 
| float      = 
| border     = 
| caption    = 
| alt        = 
| relief     = 
| AlternativeMap = 
| label      = 
| label_size = 
| position   = 
| background = 
| mark       = 
| marksize   = 
| link       = 
| lat_deg    = 
| lon_deg    = 
}}
| width="20px" | | valign="top" | 
{{Location map
| {{{1}}}
| width      = 
| float      = 
| border     = 
| caption    = 
| alt        = 
| relief     = 
| AlternativeMap = 
| label      = 
| label_size = 
| position   = 
| background = 
| mark       = 
| marksize   = 
| link       = 
| lat_deg    = 
| lat_min    = 
| lat_sec    = 
| lat_dir    = 
| lon_deg    = 
| lon_min    = 
| lon_sec    = 
| lon_dir    = 
}}
|} == Parameters == {| class="wikitable" style="width:100%;" ! colspan="2" style="background-color:lightblue" | Map display parameters |- ! Parameter ! Description |- | {{{1}}} | '''Required'''. Use the name of the map as the first unnamed parameter. For example, specify ''England'' to use the values in {{tl|Location map England}}. See the [[#Examples|examples]] below. |- | width | Determines the width of the map in [[w:pixel|pixel]]s. The default is 240. Do not include px, for example: width=300, not width=300px. |- | float | Specifies the position of the map on the page. Valid values are left, right, center and none. The default is right''. |- | border | Specifies the color of the 1px map border. The default is ''lightgrey'' (see [[w:Web colors|Web colors]]). If set to none, no border will be generated. This parameter is seldom used. |- | caption | The text of a caption to be displayed below the map. Specifying a caption will cause the map to be displayed with a frame. If caption is defined but is not assigned a value, the map will not be framed and no caption will be displayed. If caption is not defined, the map will not be framed and a default caption will be generated. The default caption is created from the label parameter (or the current page name if label not defined) and the name parameter from map definition template. See the [[#Examples|examples]] below. |- | alt | Alt text for map; used by screen readers. |- | relief | Any non-blank value (1, yes, etc.) will cause the template to display the map specified in the map definition template as image1, which is usually a [[w:Relief mapping (computer graphics)|relief map]]. See the example at [[#Relief parameter|below]]. |- | AlternativeMap | Allows the use of an alternative map. The image must have the same edge coordinates as the location map template. See the example [[#AlternativeMap parameter|below]]. |- | overlay_image | Allows an overlay to be superimposed on the map. This parameter is seldom used. |- ! colspan="2" style="background-color:lightblue" | Label and mark parameters |- ! Parameter ! Description |- | label | The text of the label to display next to the mark. A wiki link can be used. The default if not specified is no label, just the marker. |- | label_size | The font size to use for the label, given as a percentage of the normal font size (<100 = smaller, >100 = larger). The default is 90. Do not include %, for example: label_size=80, not label_size=80%. |- | label_width | The width to use for the label, given as an [[w:Em (typography)#CSS|em size]]. The default is 6. Do not include em, for example: label_width=7, not label_width=7em. |- | position | The position of the label relative to the mark. Valid values are left, right, top and bottom. The default is right''. |- | background | The background color to use for the label. See [[w:Web colors|Web colors]]. The default is no background color, which shows the map image behind the label. |- | mark | The name of an image to display as the mark. The default is [[:File:Red pog.svg|Red pog.svg]] ([[File:Red pog.svg|8px]]). See examples at [[Commons:Location markers]] and [[Commons:Category:Map icons]]. |- | marksize | The size of the mark in [[w:pixel|pixel]]s. The default is 8. Do not include px, for example: marksize=10, not marksize=10px. |- | link | Specifies a wiki link which will be followed if the reader clicks on the mark. The name of the linked page is displayed when the mouse pointer hovers over the mark. |- | lat_deg | '''Required'''. The degrees of [[w:latitude|latitude]]. This value can be specified using [[w:decimal degrees|decimal degrees]] and when this format is used minutes and seconds should not be specified. |- | lat_min | The minutes of latitude. |- | lat_sec | The seconds of latitude. Usually not necessary. |- | lat_dir | N if north (default value) or S for south of the [[w:Equator|Equator]]. Other values will be disregarded. Not required if using signed decimal degrees (i.e. negative numbers for southern latitude). |- | lon_deg | '''Required'''. The degrees of [[w:longitude|longitude]]. This value can be specified using [[w:decimal degrees|decimal degrees]] and when this format is used minutes and seconds should not be specified. |- | lon_min | The minutes of longitude. |- | lon_sec | The seconds of longitude. Usually not necessary. |- | lon_dir | E for east (default value) or W for west of the [[w:Prime Meridian|Prime Meridian]]. Other values will be disregarded. Not required if using signed decimal degrees (i.e. negative numbers for western longitude). |} == Available map templates == * [[:Category:Location map templates]] - templates sorted by category * [[Special:Prefixindex/Template:Location map]] - another search that might help == Creating new map definition templates == See [[Template:Location map/Creating a new map template|Creating a new map template]]. == Examples == === Default width and float, no label, default caption (decimal coordinates) === {{Location map | Croatia | alt = Pag is on an island. | lat_deg = 44.44 | lon_deg = 15.05 }} 
{{Location map | Croatia
| alt     = Pag is on an island.
| lat_deg = 44.44
| lon_deg = 15.05
}}
Note: When a label is not specified, the default caption is "Page name (Map name)", so if this example was viewed on a page named ''Pag'', the default caption would be "Pag (Croatia)". Likewise, on a page named ''Pag (town)'', the default caption would be "Pag (town) (Croatia)". {{clear}} === Map with the default caption (degrees/minutes) === {{Location map | Croatia | width = 200 | float = right | alt = Pag is on an island. | label = Pag | position = right | mark = Green pog.svg | lat_deg = 44 | lat_min = 26 | lon_deg = 15 | lon_min = 3 }} 
{{Location map | Croatia
| width = 200
| float = right
| alt = Pag is on an island.
| label = Pag
| position = right
| mark = Green pog.svg 
| lat_deg = 44 | lat_min = 26 
| lon_deg = 15 | lon_min = 3  
}}
Note: When a label is specified, the default caption is "Label text (Map name)", seen as "Pag (Croatia)" in this example. {{clear}} === Marker/Label outside of Map === {{Location map | Croatia | width = 200 | float = right | alt = Rubicon in Italy (outside the map) | label = Rubicon | position = right | lat_deg = 44.44 | lon_deg = 11.85 }} 
{{Location map | Croatia
| width    = 200
| float    = right
| alt      = Rubicon in Italy (outside the map)
| label    = Rubicon
| position = right
| lat_deg  = 44.44
| lon_deg  = 11.85 
}}
{{clear}} === Map with a custom caption and text background === {{Location map | Croatia | width = 200 | float = right | caption = Imotski in Croatia | alt = Imotski is in Croatia. | label = Imotski | position = right | background = #FFFFDD | lat_deg = 43.44 | lon_deg = 17.21 }} 
{{Location map | Croatia
| width      = 200
| float      = right
| caption    = Imotski in Croatia
| alt        = Imotski is in Croatia.
| label      = Imotski
| position   = right
| background = #FFFFDD
| lat_deg    = 43.44
| lon_deg    = 17.21
}}
{{clear}} === Map with enlarged marker and label === {{Location map | Croatia | width = 200 | float = right | caption = Pag Island in Croatia | alt = Pag is on an island | label = Pag | label_size = 200 | position = right | background = #FFFFDD | marksize = 14 | lat_deg = 44.44 | lon_deg = 15.05 }} 
{{Location map | Croatia
| width      = 200
| float      = right
| caption    = Pag Island in Croatia
| alt        = Pag is on an island
| label      = Pag
| label_size = 200 
| position   = right
| background = #FFFFDD
| marksize   = 14
| lat_deg    = 44.44
| lon_deg    = 15.05
}}
{{clear}} === Map with no caption or border === {{Location map | Bosnia and Herzegovina | width = 200 | float = right | caption = | alt = BrÄko is in northeast Bosnia. | label = BrÄko | position = left | lat_deg = 44.87 | lon_deg = 18.81 }} 
{{Location map | Bosnia and Herzegovina
| width    = 200
| float    = right
| caption  =
| alt      = BrÄko is in northeast Bosnia.
| label    = BrÄko
| position = left
| lat_deg  = 44.87
| lon_deg  = 18.81
}}
{{clear}} === Relief parameter === {{Location map | Mexico | relief = 1 | label = PopocatÃ©petl | lat_deg = 19 | lat_min = 1 | lat_sec = 20 | lat_dir = N | lon_deg = 98 | lon_min = 37 | lon_sec = 40 | lon_dir = W }} 
{{Location map | Mexico
| relief  = 1
| label   = PopocatÃ©petl
| lat_deg = 19 | lat_min =  1 | lat_sec = 20 | lat_dir = N
| lon_deg = 98 | lon_min = 37 | lon_sec = 40 | lon_dir = W
}}
{{clear}} {{Location map | Mexico | relief = | label = PopocatÃ©petl | lat_deg = 19 | lat_min = 1 | lat_sec = 20 | lat_dir = N | lon_deg = 98 | lon_min = 37 | lon_sec = 40 | lon_dir = W }} 
{{Location map | Mexico
| relief  =
| label   = PopocatÃ©petl
| lat_deg = 19 | lat_min =  1 | lat_sec = 20 | lat_dir = N
| lon_deg = 98 | lon_min = 37 | lon_sec = 40 | lon_dir = W
}}
{{clear}} === AlternativeMap parameter === {{Location map | Nepal | AlternativeMap = Nepal relief location map.jpg | caption = Location of Biratnagar Airport in Nepal | alt = Biratnagar Airport is located in southeastern Nepal | label = Biratnagar | position = top | mark = Airplane silhouette.svg | marksize = 10 | lat_deg = 26 | lat_min = 28 | lat_sec = 53 | lat_dir = N | lon_deg = 87 | lon_min = 15 | lon_sec = 50 | lon_dir = E }} 
{{Location map | Nepal
| AlternativeMap = Nepal relief location map.jpg
| caption = Location of Biratnagar Airport in Nepal
| alt = Biratnagar Airport is located in southeastern Nepal
| label = Biratnagar
| position = top
| mark = Airplane silhouette.svg
| marksize = 10
| lat_deg = 26 | lat_min = 28 | lat_sec = 53 | lat_dir = N
| lon_deg = 87 | lon_min = 15 | lon_sec = 50 | lon_dir = E
}}
{{clear}} {{Location map | Nepal | AlternativeMap = | caption = Location of Biratnagar Airport in Nepal | alt = Biratnagar Airport is located in southeastern Nepal | label = Biratnagar | position = top | mark = Airplane silhouette.svg | marksize = 10 | lat_deg = 26 | lat_min = 28 | lat_sec = 53 | lat_dir = N | lon_deg = 87 | lon_min = 15 | lon_sec = 50 | lon_dir = E }} 
{{Location map | Nepal
| AlternativeMap =
| caption = Location of Biratnagar Airport in Nepal
| alt = Biratnagar Airport is located in southeastern Nepal
| label = Biratnagar
| position = top
| mark = Airplane silhouette.svg
| marksize = 10
| lat_deg = 26 | lat_min = 28 | lat_sec = 53 | lat_dir = N
| lon_deg = 87 | lon_min = 15 | lon_sec = 50 | lon_dir = E
}}
{{clear}} === Map that crosses 180Â° meridian === {{Location map | Fiji | width = 180 | float = right | label = Suva | position = right | background = yellow | mark = Locator_Dot.png | marksize = 7 | lat_deg = 18 | lat_min = 8 | lat_sec = 0 | lat_dir = S | lon_deg = 178 | lon_min = 26 | lon_sec = 0 | lon_dir = E }} 
{{Location map | Fiji
| width      = 180
| float      = right
| label      = Suva
| position   = right
| background = yellow
| mark       = Locator_Dot.png
| marksize   = 7
| lat_deg =  18 | lat_min =  8 | lat_sec = 0 | lat_dir = S
| lon_deg = 178 | lon_min = 26 | lon_sec = 0 | lon_dir = E
}}
{{clear}} == See also == {{Commons|Location markers}} {{Commons category|Map pointers}} ;Location map templates * [[Template:Location map+]], to display unlimited number of markers and labels * [[Template:Location map~]], helper template for Location map+ [[Category:Mapping templates|{{PAGENAME}}]]
{{permprot}}

page.title: Template:Location map/Creating a new map template

revision.comment: [[WB:REVERT|Reverted]] edits by [[Special:Contributions/14.139.116.34|14.139.116.34]] ([[User talk:14.139.116.34|talk]]) to last version by Adrignola
revision.text:
== Understanding map definition templates == {{expand}} The {{tl|Location map}} family of templates utilize any one of a set of map definition templates. These are not forks but rather auxiliary templates and are must have names such as "Location map ''location''", where ''location'' is the name of the area covered by the map. To create a simple map definition template using an image of a map with an [[w:equirectangular projection|equirectangular]] [[w:Mercator projection|Mercator projection]]: # Create a new map image and upload it to [[commons:Main Page|Wikimedia commons]] or find an existing map on the same site. # Create a template named Template:Location map ''location'', copy the content below into it and substitute the appropriate values. As an example of a map that uses an equirectangular projection, we use {{tl|Location map Bosnia and Herzegovina}}. Please do not experiment using active templates. 
{{#switch:{{{1}}}
| name   = Bosnia and Herzegovina
| top    = 45.4
| bottom = 42.4
| left   = 15.5
| right  = 19.9
| image  = Bosnia and Herzegovina location map.svg
| image1 = Bosnia and Herzegovina relief location map.png
}}
{{Location map/Info}}
{| class="wikitable" style="width: 50%;" ! Parameter ! Description |- | name | The name of the area covered |- | top | The latitude of the top edge of the image using [[w:decimal degrees|decimal degrees]] |- | bottom | The latitude of the bottom edge of the image |- | left | longitude of the left edges of the image |- | right | longitude of the right edges of the image |- | image | The name of the image file on Commons |- | image1 | The name of an alternate image, usually a relief map that can be accessed using the relief parameter. |} Maps of this type work will for small to mid sized areas. {{tl|Location map USA}} is another example of a map description template that uses an equirectangular projection. Notice that the image of the country is not what most would expect. Maps that use other projections, such as {{tl|Location map USA2}}, which uses an equidistant [[w:conic projection|conic projection]]. require formulas which are used to calculate the x and y coordinates for the location mark. Understanding these formulas requires a familiarity with the subject and is currently beyond the scope of this discussion. Note that the formula for x evaluates to 0 for the left edge of the image and 100 for the right edge. Likewise, the formula for y evaluates to 0 for the top edge and 100 for the bottom edge. [[Category:Template subpages|{{PAGENAME}}]]

< [[Template:Location map]]
{{template other | {{#ifeq: {{PROTECTIONLEVEL:move}} | sysop | {{pp-template}} | {{#if: {{PROTECTIONLEVEL:edit}} | {{pp-template}} | }} }} }} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; margin-top:0;" |+ Location map of {{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|name}} |- ! name |colspan="3"| {{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|name}} |- {{#if:{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|top}}| !rowspan="4"{{!}}border
coordinates {{!}}- {{!}}colspan="3"{{!}} {{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|top}} {{!}}- {{!}}style="width:7em;"{{!}} {{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|left}} {{!}} â†â†•â†’ {{!}}style="width:7em;"{{!}} {{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|right}} {{#ifexpr: {{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|right}} > 180 | ({{#expr: {{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|right}} - 360 }})}} {{!}}- {{!}}colspan="3"{{!}} {{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|bottom}} {{!}}- ! map center {{!}}colspan="4"{{!}} {{coord|{{#expr:({{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|top}}+{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|bottom}})/2}}|{{#expr:({{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|left}}+{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|right}} {{#ifexpr:{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|right}}< {{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|left}}| + 360}})/2}}}} {{!}}- }} {{#if:{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|x}}| ! x {{!}}colspan="3" style="overflow: auto; white-space: auto; width: 350px"{{!}} {{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|x}} {{!}}- ! y {{!}}colspan="3" style="overflow: auto; white-space: auto; width: 350px"{{!}} {{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|y}} {{!}}- }} ! image |colspan="3"| [[:Image:{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|image}}|{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|image}}]] |- |colspan="4"|[[image:{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|image}}|400x400px|{{BASEPAGENAME}}]] |- {{#if:{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|image1}}| ! image1 {{!}}colspan="3"{{!}} [[:Image:{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|image1}}|{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|image1}}]] {{!}}- {{!}}colspan="4"{{!}}[[image:{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|image1}}|400x400px|{{BASEPAGENAME}}]] {{!}}- }} {{#if:{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|image2}}| ! image2 {{!}}colspan="3"{{!}} [[:Image:{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|image2}}|{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|image2}}]] {{!}}- {{!}}colspan="4"{{!}}[[image:{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|image2}}|400x400px|{{BASEPAGENAME}}]] {{!}}- }} {{#if: {{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|skew}} | ! skew {{!}}colspan="3"{{!}} {{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|skew}} {{!}}- }} {{#if: {{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|lat_skew}} | ! lat_skew {{!}}colspan="3"{{!}} {{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|lat_skew}} {{!}}- }} {{#if: {{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|mark}} | ! mark {{!}}colspan="3"{{!}} [[:File:{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|mark}}|{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|mark}}]] {{!}}- }} {{#if: {{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|marksize}} | ! marksize {{!}}colspan="3"{{!}} {{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|marksize}} {{!}}- }} |} {{documentation}}

{{Documentation subpage}} This template displays values for the map templates such as {{tl|Location map Croatia}}. These templates are used by {{tl|Location map}} to obtain values such as the file name and the border coordinates of each location map. === Usage === ;On a template page 
{{Location map/Info}}
;On a documentation sup-page 
{{Location map/Info}}
====The name parameter==== The {{tl|Location map}} family of templates uses the value assigned to name to generate alt text. It is used to construct the sentence "label is located in name". Assign a value to that fits in the sentence. For example: : Chicago is located in the United States. So {{para|name|the United states}}. : Santo Domingo is located in the Dominican Republic. So {{para|name|the Dominican Republic}}. === See also === * [[Template:Location map]], to display a single marker and label * [[Template:Location map+]], to display unlimited number of markers and labels * [[Template:Location map~]], helper template for Location map+ [[Category:Template subpages|{{PAGENAME}}]]
{{permprot}}

{{Documentation subpage}} [[File:As-map.png|thumb|250px|Map of Australia]] '''Template:Location map Australia''' is a location map definition used to overlay markers and labels on an [[w:equirectangular projection|equirectangular projection]] map of [[w:Australia|Australia]]. The markers are placed by [[w:latitude|latitude]] and [[w:longitude|longitude]] coordinates on the default map or a similar map image. == Usage == These definitions are used by the following templates when invoked with parameter "Australia": * {{tlx|Location map | Australia | ...}} * {{tlx|Location map+ | Australia | ...}} * {{tlx|Location map~ | Australia | ...}} == Map definition == * '''name''' = {{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|name}} *: Name used in the default map caption * '''image''' = [[:File:{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|image}}|{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|image}}]] *: The default map image, without "Image:" or "File:" {{#if:{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|image1}}| * '''image1''' = [[:File:{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|image1}}|{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|image1}}]] *: An alternative map image, usually a relief map, can be displayed via the ''relief'' or ''AlternativeMap'' parameters }}{{#if:{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|image2}}| * '''image2''' = [[:File:{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|image2}}|{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|image2}}]] *: A second alternative map image, can be displayed via the ''AlternativeMap'' parameter only }}{{#if:{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|top}}{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|bottom}}{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|left}}{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|right}}| * '''top''' = {{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|top}} *: [[w:Latitude|Latitude]] at top edge of map, in [[w:decimal degrees|decimal degrees]] * '''bottom''' = {{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|bottom}} *: Latitude at bottom edge of map, in decimal degrees * '''left''' = {{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|left}} *: [[w:Longitude|Longitude]] at left edge of map, in decimal degrees * '''right''' = {{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|right}} *: Longitude at right edge of map, in decimal degrees }}{{#if:{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|x}}{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|y}}| * '''x''' = {{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|x}} *: An expression to calculate a location on the map via its [[w:longitude|longitude]]; evaluates as 0 along the left edge and 100 along the right edge * '''y''' = {{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|y}} *: An expression to calculate a location on the map via its [[w:latitude|latitude]]; evaluates as 0 along the top edge and 100 along the bottom edge }} {{#if:{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|image1}}| == Alternative map == The map defined as '''image1''' ({{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|image1}}) can be displayed by using the ''relief'' or ''AlternativeMap'' parameters in {{tl|Location map}} and {{tl|Location map+}}. {{#if:{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|image2}}| The map defined as '''image2''' ({{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|image2}}) can only be displayed by using the ''AlternativeMap'' parameter.}} The use of these two parameters is shown in the examples below. }} == Examples using location map templates == === Location map, using default map (image) === {{Location map | Australia | width = 200 | lat_deg = -35.31 | lon_deg = 149.12 | label = Canberra }} 
{{Location map | Australia
| width   = 200
| lat_deg = -35.31
| lon_deg = 149.12
| label   = Canberra
}}
{{clear}} === Location map+, using AlternativeMap === {{Location map+ | Australia | AlternativeMap = Australia relief map.jpg | width = 200 | caption = Two locations in Australia | places = {{Location map~ | Australia | lat_deg = -35.31 | lon_deg = 149.12 | label = Canberra }} {{Location map~ | Australia | lat_deg = -31.95 | lon_deg = 115.86 | label = Perth }} }} 
{{Location map+ | Australia
| AlternativeMap = Australia relief map.jpg
| width   = 200
| caption = Two locations in Australia
| places  =
  {{Location map~ | Australia
  | lat_deg = -35.31
  | lon_deg = 149.12
  | label   = Canberra
  }}
  {{Location map~ | Australia
  | lat_deg = -31.95
  | lon_deg = 115.86
  | label   = Perth
  }}
}}
{{clear}} == See also == * [[Template:Location map]], to display one mark and label using latitude and longitude * [[Template:Location map+]], to display an unlimited number of marks and labels [[Category:Location map templates|Australia]]

{{Documentation subpage}} '''Template:Location map USA''' is a location map definition used to overlay markers and labels on an [[w:equirectangular projection|equirectangular projection]] map of the [[w:United States|United States]]. The markers are placed by [[w:latitude|latitude]] and [[w:longitude|longitude]] coordinates on the default map or a similar map image. == Usage == These definitions are used by the following templates when invoked with parameter "USA": * {{tlx|Location map | USA | ...}} * {{tlx|Location map+ | USA | ...}} * {{tlx|Location map~ | USA | ...}} == Map definition == ; name : used in default map caption ({{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|name}}) ; image : the default map image, without "Image:" or "File:" ([[:File:{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|image}}|{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|image}}]]) ; top : [[w:latitude|latitude]] at top edge of map, in [[w:decimal degrees|decimal degrees]] ({{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|top}}) ; bottom : latitude at bottom edge of map, in decimal degrees ({{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|bottom}}) ; left : [[w:longitude|longitude]] at left edge of map, in decimal degrees ({{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|left}}) ; right : longitude at right edge of map, in decimal degrees ({{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|right}}) == Examples == === Location map === {{Location map | USA | width = 250 | lat = 38.895 | long = -77.037 | label = Washington, D.C. }} 
{{Location map | USA
| width = 250
| lat   = 38.895
| long  = -77.037
| label = Washington, D.C.
}}
{{clear}} === Location map+ === {{Location map+ | USA | caption = Two locations in the USA | width = 250 | places = {{Location map~ | USA | lat = 38.89 | long = -77.04 | label = Washington, D.C. }} {{Location map~ | USA | lat = 47.61 | long = -122.33 | label = Seattle }} }} 
{{Location map+ | USA
| caption = Two locations in the USA
| width   = 250
| places  =
  {{Location map~ | USA
  | lat   = 38.89
  | long  = -77.04
  | label = Washington, D.C.
  }}
  {{Location map~ | USA
  | lat   = 47.61
  | long  = -122.33
  | label = Seattle
  }}
}}
{{clear}} == See also == * [[Template:Location map USA relief]], displays a relief map (for infoboxes that do not support alternative maps) * [[Template:Location map USA2]], uses a different map with different edge coordinates ; Location map templates * [[Template:Location map]], displays one mark using latitude and longitude * [[Template:Location map+]], to display unlimited number of markers and labels [[Category:Location map templates|USA]]

{{#switch:{{{1}}} | name = United States | x = 50.0 + 124.03149777329222 * ((1.9694462586094064-({{{2}}}* pi / 180)) * sin(0.6010514667026994 * ({{{3}}} + 96) * pi / 180)) | y = 50.0 + 1.6155950752393982 * 124.03149777329222 * ( 0.02613325650382181 - (1.3236744353715044 - (1.9694462586094064 - ({{{2}}} * pi / 180)) * cos(0.6010514667026994 * ({{{3}}} + 96) * pi / 180))) | image = Usa edcp location map.svg | image1 = Usa edcp relief location map.png }}<noinclude><!-- -- -- The above switch-statement branches by text in parameter #1, -- returning the associated value after each equals sign ("="). --> {{Location map/Info}} {{Documentation}} </noinclude>

{{Documentation subpage}} '''Template:Location map USA2''' is a location map definition used to overlay markers and labels on an [[w:equidistant conic projection|equidistant conic projection]] map of the [[w:United States|United States]]. The markers are placed by [[w:latitude|latitude]] and [[w:longitude|longitude]] coordinates on the default map or a similar map image. == Usage == These definitions are used by the following templates when invoked with parameter "USA2": * {{tlx|Location map | USA2 | ...}} * {{tlx|Location map+ | USA2 | ...}} * {{tlx|Location map~ | USA2 | ...}} == Map definition == * '''name''' = {{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|name}} *: Name used in the default map caption * '''image''' = [[:File:{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|image}}|{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|image}}]] *: The default map image, without "Image:" or "File:" * '''image1''' = [[:File:{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|image1}}|{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|image1}}]] *: An alternative map image, usually a relief map, can be displayed via the ''relief'' or ''AlternativeMap'' parameters {{#if:{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|image2}}| * '''image2''' = [[:File:{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|image2}}|{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|image2}}]] *: A second alternative map image, can be displayed via the ''AlternativeMap'' parameter only }}{{#if:{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|top}}{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|bottom}}{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|left}}{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|right}}| * '''top''' = {{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|top}} *: [[Latitude]] at top edge of map, in [[decimal degrees]] * '''bottom''' = {{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|bottom}} *: Latitude at bottom edge of map, in decimal degrees * '''left''' = {{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|left}} *: [[Longitude]] at left edge of map, in decimal degrees * '''right''' = {{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|right}} *: Longitude at right edge of map, in decimal degrees }}{{#if:{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|x}}{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|y}}| * '''x''' = {{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|x}} *: An expression to calculate a location on the map via its [[w:longitude|longitude]]; evaluates as 0 along the left edge and 100 along the right edge * '''y''' = {{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|y}} *: An expression to calculate a location on the map via its [[w:latitude|latitude]]; evaluates as 0 along the top edge and 100 along the bottom edge }} == Alternative map == The map defined as '''image1''' ({{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|image1}}) can be displayed by using the ''relief'' or ''AlternativeMap'' parameters in {{tl|Location map}} and {{tl|Location map+}}. {{#if:{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|image2}}| The map defined as '''image2''' ({{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|image2}}) can only be displayed by using the ''AlternativeMap'' parameter.}} The use of these two parameters is shown in the examples below. == Examples using location map templates == === Location map, using default map (image) === {{Location map | USA2 | width = 250 | label = Washington, D.C. | lat_deg = 38.89 | lon_deg = -77.04 }} 
{{Location map | USA2
| width   = 250
| label   = Washington, D.C.
| lat_deg = 38.89
| lon_deg = -77.04
}}

{{Documentation subpage}} {{Location map/Info}} == Usage == These definitions are used by the following templates when invoked with parameter "USA relief": * {{tlx|Location map | USA relief| ...}} * {{tlx|Location map+ | USA relief| ...}} * {{tlx|Location map~ | USA relief| ...}} == Map definition == * '''name''' = {{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|name}} *: Name used in the default map caption * '''image''' = [[:File:{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|image}}|{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|image}}]] *: The default map image, without "Image:" or "File:" {{#if:{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|image2}}| * '''image2''' = [[:File:{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|image2}}|{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|image2}}]] *: A second alternative map image, can be displayed via the ''AlternativeMap'' parameter only }}{{#if:{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|top}}{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|bottom}}{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|left}}{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|right}}| * '''top''' = {{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|top}} *: [[w:Latitude|Latitude]] at top edge of map, in [[w:decimal degrees|decimal degrees]] * '''bottom''' = {{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|bottom}} *: Latitude at bottom edge of map, in decimal degrees * '''left''' = {{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|left}} *: [[w:Longitude|Longitude]] at left edge of map, in decimal degrees * '''right''' = {{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|right}} *: Longitude at right edge of map, in decimal degrees }}{{#if:{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|x}}{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|y}}| * '''x''' = {{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|x}} *: An expression to calculate a location on the map via its [[w:longitude|longitude]]; evaluates as 0 along the left edge and 100 along the right edge * '''y''' = {{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|y}} *: An expression to calculate a location on the map via its [[w:latitude|latitude]]; evaluates as 0 along the top edge and 100 along the bottom edge }} == Example == {{Location map | USA relief | width = 200 | lat = 38.895 | long = -77.037 | label = Washington, D.C. }} 
{{Location map | USA relief
| width = 200
| lat = 38.895
| long = -77.037
| label = Washington, D.C.
}}
{{clear}} == See also == * [[Template:Location map USA]] * [[Template:Location map USA2]] [[Category:Location map templates|USA relief]]

{{#switch:{{{1}}} | name = Croatia | top = 46.8 | bottom = 42.1 | left = 13.1 | right = 19.9 | image = Croatia_location_map.svg | skew = 1.0 | lat_skew = 0.0 }}<noinclude>{{Location map/Info}}{{documentation}}</noinclude>

{{Documentation subpage}} '''Template:Location map Croatia''' is a location map definition used to overlay markers and labels on an [[w:equirectangular projection|equirectangular projection]] map of [[w:Croatia|Croatia]]. The markers are placed by [[w:latitude|latitude]] and [[w:longitude|longitude]] coordinates on the default map or a similar map image. == Usage == These definitions are used by the following templates when invoked with parameter "Croatia": * {{tlx|Location map | Croatia | ...}} * {{tlx|Location map+ | Croatia | ...}} * {{tlx|Location map~ | Croatia | ...}} == Map definition == ; name : used in default map caption ({{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|name}}) ; image : the default map image, without "Image:" or "File:" ([[:File:{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|image}}|{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|image}}]]) ; top : [[w:latitude|latitude]] at top edge of map, in [[w:decimal degrees|decimal degrees]] ({{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|top}}) ; bottom : latitude at bottom edge of map, in decimal degrees ({{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|bottom}}) ; left : [[w:longitude|longitude]] at left edge of map, in decimal degrees ({{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|left}}) ; right : longitude at right edge of map, in decimal degrees ({{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|right}}) ; skew : skew to narrow longitudes ({{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|skew}}) ; lat_skew : skew to arc latitudes at edges ({{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|lat_skew}}) == Examples == === Location map === {{Location map | Croatia | width = 250 | lat = 45.82 | long = 15.98 | label = Zagreb }} 
{{Location map | Croatia
| width  = 250
| lat    = 45.82
| long   = 15.98
| label  = Zagreb
}}
{{clear}} === Location map+ === {{Location map+ | Croatia | caption = Two locations in Croatia | width = 250 | places = {{Location map~ | Croatia | lat = 45.82 | long = 15.98 | label = Zagreb }} {{Location map~ | Croatia | lat = 43.5 | long = 16.43 | label = Split }} }} 
{{Location map+ | Croatia
| caption = Two locations in Croatia
| width   = 250
| places  =
  {{Location map~ | Croatia
  | lat   = 45.82
  | long  = 15.98
  | label = Zagreb
  }}
  {{Location map~ | Croatia
  | lat   = 43.5
  | long  = 16.43
  | label = Split
  }}
}}
{{clear}} == See also == * [[Template:Location map]] * [[Template:Location map+]] [[Category:Location map templates|Croatia]]

{{#switch:{{{1}}} | name = Bosnia and Herzegovina | top = 45.4 | bottom = 42.4 | left = 15.5 | right = 19.9 | image = Bosnia and Herzegovina location map.svg | image1 = Bosnia and Herzegovina relief location map.png }}<noinclude>{{Location map/Info}} <!-- -- The above switch-statement branches by text in parameter #1, -- returning the associated value after each equals sign ("="). --> {{Documentation}} </noinclude>

{{Documentation subpage}} [[File:Bk-map.png|thumb|250px|Map of Bosnia and Herzegovina]] '''Template:Location map Bosnia and Herzegovina''' is a location map definition used to overlay markers and labels on an [[w:equirectangular projection|equirectangular projection]] map of [[w:Bosnia and Herzegovina|Bosnia and Herzegovina]]. The markers are placed by [[w:latitude|latitude]] and [[w:longitude|longitude]] coordinates on the default map or a similar map image. == Usage == These definitions are used by the following templates when invoked with parameter "Bosnia and Herzegovina": * {{tlx|Location map | Bosnia and Herzegovina | ...}} * {{tlx|Location map+ | Bosnia and Herzegovina | ...}} * {{tlx|Location map~ | Bosnia and Herzegovina | ...}} == Map definition == * '''name''' = {{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|name}} *: Name used in the default map caption * '''image''' = [[:File:{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|image}}|{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|image}}]] *: The default map image, without "Image:" or "File:" * '''image1''' = [[:File:{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|image1}}|{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|image1}}]] *: An alternative map image, usually a relief map, can be displayed via the ''relief'' or ''AlternativeMap'' parameters {{#if:{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|image2}}| * '''image2''' = [[:File:{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|image2}}|{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|image2}}]] *: A second alternative map image, can be displayed via the ''AlternativeMap'' parameter only }}{{#if:{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|top}}{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|bottom}}{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|left}}{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|right}}| * '''top''' = {{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|top}} *: [[w:Latitude|Latitude]] at top edge of map, in [[w:decimal degrees|decimal degrees]] * '''bottom''' = {{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|bottom}} *: Latitude at bottom edge of map, in decimal degrees * '''left''' = {{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|left}} *: [[w:Longitude|Longitude]] at left edge of map, in decimal degrees * '''right''' = {{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|right}} *: Longitude at right edge of map, in decimal degrees }}{{#if:{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|x}}{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|y}}| * '''x''' = {{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|x}} *: An expression to calculate a location on the map via its [[w:longitude|longitude]]; evaluates as 0 along the left edge and 100 along the right edge * '''y''' = {{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|y}} *: An expression to calculate a location on the map via its [[w:latitude|latitude]]; evaluates as 0 along the top edge and 100 along the bottom edge }} == Alternative map == The map defined as '''image1''' ({{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|image1}}) can be displayed by using the ''relief'' or ''AlternativeMap'' parameters in {{tl|Location map}} and {{tl|Location map+}}. {{#if:{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|image2}}| The map defined as '''image2''' ({{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|image2}}) can only be displayed by using the ''AlternativeMap'' parameter.}} The use of these two parameters is shown in the examples below. == Examples using location map templates == === Location map, using default map (image) === {{Location map | Bosnia and Herzegovina | width = 200 | label = Sarajevo | lat_deg = 43.85 | lon_deg = 18.36 }} 
{{Location map | Bosnia and Herzegovina
| width   = 200
| label   = Sarajevo
| lat_deg = 43.85
| lon_deg = 18.36
}}
{{clear}} === Location map, using relief map (image1) === {{Location map | Bosnia and Herzegovina | relief = yes | width = 200 | label = Sarajevo | lat_deg = 43.85 | lon_deg = 18.36 }} 
{{Location map | Bosnia and Herzegovina
| relief   = yes
| width   = 200
| label   = Sarajevo
| lat_deg = 43.85
| lon_deg = 18.36
}}
{{clear}} === Location map+, using AlternativeMap === {{Location map+ | Bosnia and Herzegovina | AlternativeMap = Bosnia and Herzegovina physical map.svg | width = 200 | caption = Two locations in Bosnia and Herzegovina | places = {{Location map~ | Bosnia and Herzegovina | label = Sarajevo | lat_deg = 43.85 | lon_deg = 18.36 }} {{Location map~ | Bosnia and Herzegovina | label = Banja Luka | lat_deg = 44.77 | lon_deg = 17.18 }} }} 
{{Location map+ | Bosnia and Herzegovina
| AlternativeMap = Bosnia and Herzegovina physical map.svg
| width   = 200
| caption = Two locations in Bosnia and Herzegovina
| places  =
  {{Location map~ | Bosnia and Herzegovina
  | label   = Sarajevo
  | lat_deg = 43.85
  | lon_deg = 18.36
  }}
  {{Location map~ | Bosnia and Herzegovina
  | label   = Banja Luka
  | lat_deg = 44.77
  | lon_deg = 17.18
  }}
}}
{{clear}} == See also == * [[Template:Location map]], to display one mark and label using latitude and longitude * [[Template:Location map+]], to display an unlimited number of marks and labels [[Category:Location map templates|Bosnia and Herzegovina]]
#REDIRECT [[Template:Location map Bosnia and Herzegovina]]

{{Documentation subpage}} '''Template:Location map Fiji''' is a location map definition used to overlay markers and labels on an [[w:equirectangular projection|equirectangular projection]] map of [[w:Fiji|Fiji]]. The markers are placed by [[w:latitude|latitude]] and [[w:longitude|longitude]] coordinates on the default map or a similar map image. == Usage == These definitions are used by the following templates when invoked with parameter "Fiji": * {{tlx|Location map | Fiji | ...}} * {{tlx|Location map+ | Fiji | ...}} * {{tlx|Location map~ | Fiji | ...}} == Map definition == ; name : used in default map caption ({{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|name}}) ; image : the default map image, without "Image:" or "File:" ([[:File:{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|image}}|{{{{BASEPAGENAME}}|image}}]]) ; x : an expression to calculate a location on the map via its [[w:longitude|longitude]]; evaluates as 0 along the left edge and 100 along the right edge ; y : an expression to calculate a location on the map via its [[w:latitude|latitude]]; evaluates as 0 along the top edge and 100 along the bottom edge == Examples == === Location map: Eastern hemisphere, Deg/Min/Sec coordinates === {{Location map | Fiji | width = 150 | caption = Location of Eori in Fiji | label = Eori | background = lightblue | position = left | lat_deg= 17 | lat_min=26 | lat_sec=17 | lat_dir=S | lon_deg=177 | lon_min=03 | lon_sec=48 | lon_dir=E }} 
{{Location map | Fiji
| width      = 150
| caption    = Location of Eori in Fiji
| label      = Eori
| background = lightblue
| position   = left
| lat_deg= 17 | lat_min=26 | lat_sec=17 | lat_dir=S
| lon_deg=177 | lon_min=03 | lon_sec=48 | lon_dir=E
}}
{{clear}} === Location map: Eastern hemisphere, Decimal coordinates === {{Location map | Fiji | width = 150 | caption = Location of Eori in Fiji | label = Eori | background = lightblue | position = left | lat = -17.43806 | long = 177.06333 }} 
{{Location map | Fiji
| width      = 150
| caption    = Location of Eori in Fiji
| label      = Eori
| background = lightblue
| position   = left
| lat        = -17.43806
| long       = 177.06333
}}
{{clear}} === Location map: Western hemisphere, Deg/Min/Sec coordinates === {{Location map | Fiji | width = 150 | caption = Location of Batiki in Fiji | label = Batiki | background = lightgreen | position = bottom | lat_deg = 17 | lat_min = 47 | lat_sec = | lat_dir = S | lon_deg = 179 | lon_min = 09 | lon_sec = | lon_dir = W }} 
{{Location map | Fiji
| width      = 150
| caption    = Location of Batiki in Fiji
| label      = Batiki
| background = lightgreen
| position   = bottom
| lat_deg =  17 | lat_min = 47 | lat_sec = | lat_dir = S
| lon_deg = 179 | lon_min = 09 | lon_sec = | lon_dir = W
}}
{{clear}} === Location map: Western hemisphere, Decimal coordinates === {{Location map | Fiji | width = 150 | caption = Location of Batiki in Fiji | label = Batiki | background = lightgreen | position = bottom | lat = -17.783 | long = -179.15 }} 
{{Location map | Fiji
| width      = 150
| caption    = Location of Batiki in Fiji
| label      = Batiki
| background = lightgreen
| position   = bottom
| lat        = -17.783
| long       = -179.15
}}

When both a start and an end term are given, you can instead specify the complete term using using the parameters {{para|term}}, {{para|terms2}}, etc., as is done with {{para|term3}} in the example below. This can be helpful with complicated terms that cannot be given as simple starting or ending dates, or if you prefer something other than the default term separator (an en dash, with spaces around it if the start or end is not a simple integer date). {{Infobox officeholder |name= Samuel Adams |image= J S Copley - Samuel Adams.jpg |caption=In this 1772 portrait by John Singleton Copley, Adams points at the Massachusetts Charter, which he viewed as a constitution that protected the people's rights. |alt=A stern middle-aged man with gray hair is wearing a dark red suit. {{Documentation subpage}} === Usage === This template is used for displaying a date in both Old Style and New Style, including a discreet link to the article [[w:Old Style and New Style dates|Old Style and New Style dates]], in cases where the year is the same in both Styles. {{OldStyleDate|NS day and month|year|OS day and month}} If it helps you remember the order of the parameters, you may optionally choose to think of it like this: {{OldStyleDate|NS day and month|NS year|OS day and month|OS year}} Note that in this usage the fourth parameter will be ''ignored'' when the template is rendered. === Examples === * Usage: {{OldStyleDate|2 February|1905|20 January}} ** Result: {{OldStyleDate|2 February|1905|20 January}} * Usage: {{OldStyleDate|February 2|1905|January 20}} ** Result: {{OldStyleDate|February 2|1905|January 20}} [[Category:Date templates|OldStyleDate]]
{{permprot}}

{{#if:{{{1|}}}|{{#ifeq:{{#titleparts:{{lc:x{{{1|}}}}}|1|1}}|{{lc:x{{{1|}}}}}|[{{#if:1|{{{1|}}}}} {{#if:{{{2|}}}|{{#if:1|{{{2|}}}}}|{{#if:1|{{{1|}}}}}}}]|{{#switch:{{lc:{{#titleparts:{{{1|}}}|2}}}} |https:/ |http:/ |ftp:/=[{{#if:1|{{{1|}}}}} {{#if:{{{2|}}}|{{#if:1|{{{2|}}}}}| {{lc:{{#titleparts:{{{1|}}}|1|3}}}}{{#if:{{#titleparts:{{{1|}}}||4}}|/{{#titleparts:{{{1|}}}||4}}}}}}]|#default=[http://{{#if:1|{{{1|}}}}} {{#if:{{{2|}}}|{{#if:1|{{{2|}}}}}| {{lc:{{#titleparts:{{{1|}}}|1|1}}}}{{#if:{{#titleparts:{{{1|}}}||2}}|/{{#titleparts:{{{1|}}}||2}}}}}}]}}}}|{{#if:{{{2|}}}|{{{2|}}}|{{tlx|URL|''example.com''|''optional display text''}}}}}}{{documentation}}

{{Documentation subpage}} This template can be used to create a formatted external link. === Usage === :* {{URL|1=''url name''|2=''optional display text''}} :** The first parameter is parsed to see if it takes the form of a complete URL. If it doesn't start with an known URI scheme and a slash ("http:/" or "https:/" or "ftp:/", possibly others in the future, by editing its code), an "http://" prefix will be prepended to the specified generated target URL of the link. :** If no display text is specified or is empty, a default display text will be inferred by trying to reduce the specified URL without its recognized URI scheme (without the default "/" path of HTTP and FTP resources), and the domain name part will be forced to lowercase (for shorter and canonical display, but also to limit the occurrences of easily confusable characters, for example between letters and digits). The rest of the URL (including the rest of its path, the optional query string or the specified anchor) will be displayed unchanged. :* {{URL|2=''display text''}} :** The url or domain name is optional : if it is not specified in the first parameter or this parameter is empty, the display text becomes mandatory, and will be displayed without any change. :** If both parameters are missing or empty, a default message referencing a correct usage of this template will be generated (including a link to this page), to help editors. : '''Warning:''' :* It is strongly advised to number the parameters explicitly (notably when the value of the URL is unknown, for example when this template is used in another template specifying the effective URL as a variable value), because many URLs contain an equal sign (in their query string). In that case, the second parameter for the displayed text, if present, '''must''' also be explicitly numbered ; otherwise it will override the value of the explicitly numbered first parameter. :* If you specify a query string (starting by "?", up to the end of the string or up to the first "#" character) or an anchor (starting by '"#" up to the end of the string) in the first parameter then you '''must''' specify at least the default path "/" immediately after the domain name ; otherwise the resulting link target will be unpredictable, as the query string and/or the anchor may be unexpectedly converted to all lowercase ; it is strongly recommended to use full and canonical URLs in the first parameter (without depending on the tentative detection of a missing URI scheme or path). Don't worry, this default "/" path won't be visible in the default display text. === Examples === {|class="wikitable" |- ! Code !! Result |- | {{ {{BASEPAGENAME}} }} | {{ {{BASEPAGENAME}} }} |- | {{ {{BASEPAGENAME}} | }} | {{ {{BASEPAGENAME}} | }} |- | {{ {{BASEPAGENAME}} | EXAMPLE.com }} | {{ {{BASEPAGENAME}} | EXAMPLE.com }} |- | {{ {{BASEPAGENAME}} | example.com }} | {{ {{BASEPAGENAME}} | example.com }} |- | {{ {{BASEPAGENAME}} | www.example.com }} | {{ {{BASEPAGENAME}} | www.example.com }} |- | {{ {{BASEPAGENAME}} | http://www.example.com }} | {{ {{BASEPAGENAME}} | http://www.example.com }} |- | {{ {{BASEPAGENAME}} | https://www.example.com }} | {{ {{BASEPAGENAME}} | https://www.example.com }} |- | {{ {{BASEPAGENAME}} | ftp://www.example.com }} | {{ {{BASEPAGENAME}} | ftp://www.example.com }} |- | {{ {{BASEPAGENAME}} | ftp://ftp.example.com }} | {{ {{BASEPAGENAME}} | ftp://ftp.example.com }} |- | {{ {{BASEPAGENAME}} | http://www.example.com/ }} | {{ {{BASEPAGENAME}} | http://www.example.com/ }} |- | {{ {{BASEPAGENAME}} | http://www.example.com/path }} | {{ {{BASEPAGENAME}} | http://www.example.com/path }} |- | {{ {{BASEPAGENAME}} | www.example.com/foo }} | {{ {{BASEPAGENAME}} | www.example.com/foo }} |- | {{ {{BASEPAGENAME}} | http://www.example.com/foo | link }} | {{ {{BASEPAGENAME}} | http://www.example.com/foo | link }} |- | {{ {{BASEPAGENAME}} | www.example.com/foo | link }} | {{ {{BASEPAGENAME}} | www.example.com/foo | link}} |- | {{ {{BASEPAGENAME}} | http://www.example.com/path/ }} | {{ {{BASEPAGENAME}} | http://www.example.com/path/ }} |- | {{ {{BASEPAGENAME}} | www.example.com/foo/ }} | {{ {{BASEPAGENAME}} | www.example.com/foo/ }} |- | {{ {{BASEPAGENAME}} | 1=http://www.example.com/path?section=17 }} | {{ {{BASEPAGENAME}} | 1=http://www.example.com/path?section=17 }} |- | {{ {{BASEPAGENAME}} | 1=www.example.com/foo?page=42 }} | {{ {{BASEPAGENAME}} | 1=www.example.com/foo?page=42 }} |- | {{ {{BASEPAGENAME}} | http://www.example.com/foo/ | link }} | {{ {{BASEPAGENAME}} | http://www.example.com/foo/ | link }} |- | {{ {{BASEPAGENAME}} | www.example.com/foo/ | link }} | {{ {{BASEPAGENAME}} | www.example.com/foo/ | link}} |} == Microformat== The template wraps the displayed URL with a class="url" so that it is included in any parent [[:w:microformat|microformat]] which takes a URL parameter - see [[Wikipedia:WikiProject Microformats|the microformat project]]. == See also == * {{tl|plain link}} {{Documentation subpage}} ===Usage=== {{tl|Plainlist}} starts a plain, or unbulleted, list, such as: {{plainlist| *[[Cookbook:Appetizers|Appetizers]] *[[Cookbook:Beverages|Beverages]] *[[Cookbook:Bread Recipes|Bread]] *[[Cookbook:Breakfast Recipes|Breakfast]] *[[Cookbook:Confections|Confections]] *[[Cookbook:Dessert|Desserts]] *[[Cookbook:Meat Recipes|Meats]] *[[Cookbook:Pasta Recipes|Pasta]] *[[Cookbook:Rice Recipes|Rice]] *[[Cookbook:Salad Recipes|Salads]] }} It uses proper HTML list markup, which is more standards-compliant and more accessible than separating list items with {{tag|br|s}}. This template can be used with or without {{tl|endplainlist}}. It is an alternative to {{Tl|Unbulleted list}}, which performs the same function in a more concise but less wiki-style manner. ===Examples=== 

{{Plainlist |
*[[Cookbook:Appetizers|Appetizers]]
*[[Cookbook:Beverages|Beverages]]
*[[Cookbook:Bread Recipes|Bread]]
*[[Cookbook:Breakfast Recipes|Breakfast]]
*[[Cookbook:Confections|Confections]]
*[[Cookbook:Dessert|Desserts]]
*[[Cookbook:Meat Recipes|Meats]]
*[[Cookbook:Pasta Recipes|Pasta]]
*[[Cookbook:Rice Recipes|Rice]]
*[[Cookbook:Salad Recipes|Salads]]
}}
{{Plainlist | *[[Cookbook:Appetizers|Appetizers]] *[[Cookbook:Beverages|Beverages]] *[[Cookbook:Bread Recipes|Bread]] *[[Cookbook:Breakfast Recipes|Breakfast]] *[[Cookbook:Confections|Confections]] *[[Cookbook:Dessert|Desserts]] *[[Cookbook:Meat Recipes|Meats]] *[[Cookbook:Pasta Recipes|Pasta]] *[[Cookbook:Rice Recipes|Rice]] *[[Cookbook:Salad Recipes|Salads]] }} ;Alternative syntax: 

{{Plainlist}}
*[[Cookbook:Appetizers|Appetizers]]
*[[Cookbook:Beverages|Beverages]]
*[[Cookbook:Bread Recipes|Bread]]
*[[Cookbook:Breakfast Recipes|Breakfast]]
*[[Cookbook:Confections|Confections]]
*[[Cookbook:Dessert|Desserts]]
*[[Cookbook:Meat Recipes|Meats]]
*[[Cookbook:Pasta Recipes|Pasta]]
*[[Cookbook:Rice Recipes|Rice]]
*[[Cookbook:Salad Recipes|Salads]]
{{endplainlist}}
{{Plainlist}} *[[Cookbook:Appetizers|Appetizers]] *[[Cookbook:Beverages|Beverages]] *[[Cookbook:Bread Recipes|Bread]] *[[Cookbook:Breakfast Recipes|Breakfast]] *[[Cookbook:Confections|Confections]] *[[Cookbook:Dessert|Desserts]] *[[Cookbook:Meat Recipes|Meats]] *[[Cookbook:Pasta Recipes|Pasta]] *[[Cookbook:Rice Recipes|Rice]] *[[Cookbook:Salad Recipes|Salads]] {{Endplainlist}} ===Parameters=== * '''indent''' â€“ indents the list by a number of standard indents (one indent being 1.6em), particularly handy for inclusion in an indented discussion thread. ::Example: {{para|indent|2}} * '''style''' â€“ adds CSS style options. ::Example: {{para|style|border:solid 1px silver; background:lightyellow}} ===See also=== * {{tl|endplainlist}} * {{tl|unbulleted list}} * {{tl|flatlist}} {{#ifeq:{{SUBPAGENAME}}|sandbox|| [[Category:List formatting templates|{{PAGENAME}}]] }}
{{documentation|Template:Plainlist/doc}}

==Quick guide== {{Coord how-to}} __TOC__ ==Purpose== {{Tl|Coord}} provides a standard notation for encoding locations by their [[w:latitude|latitude]] and [[w:longitude|longitude]] coordinates. It is primarily for specifying the [[w:World Geodetic System|WGS84]] geographic coordinates of locations on [[w:Earth|Earth]], at the same time emitting a machine-readable [[w:Geo (microformat)|Geo microformat]]. However, it can also encode locations on natural satellites, dwarf planets, and planets other than Earth. ==Features== Latitude and longitude may be specified (with appropriate precision) either in decimal notation or as degrees/minutes/seconds. By default, coordinates appear in the format used to specify them. However, the format= parameter can be used to force display in a particular format. The template displays the formatted coordinates with a [[w:hyperlink|hyperlink]] to [[tswiki:GeoHack|GeoHack]]. GeoHack displays information customized to the location, including links to external mapping services. For [[w:Earth|terrestrial]] locations, a blue globe ([[File:Erioll_world.svg|18px|link=|alt=]]) appears to the left of the hyperlink. Clicking on the globe activates the [[:meta:WikiMiniAtlas|WikiMiniAtlas]] (requires [[JavaScript]]). By default, coordinates appear "in line" with the adjacent text. However, the display= parameter can be used to move the coordinates up near the page titleâ€”or display them in both places at once. The template outputs coordinates in three formats: * Degree/minutes/seconds ("DMS", precision is degrees, or degrees/minutes, or degrees/minutes/seconds, based on input precision). * Decimal degrees (varying the number of decimal places based on input precision) * A machine readable [[w:Geo (microformat)|Geo microformat]]. Logged-in users can customize how coordinates appear in their browsers. == Usage == '''{{coord|'''''latitude'''''|'''''longitude'''''|'''''[[#1|coordinate parameters]]'''''|'''''[[#2|template parameters]]'''''}}''' '''{{coord|'''''dd'''''|'''''N/S'''''|'''''dd'''''|'''''E/W'''''|'''''[[#1|coordinate parameters]]'''''|'''''[[#2|template parameters]]'''''}}''' '''{{coord|'''''dd'''''|'''''mm'''''|'''''N/S'''''|'''''dd'''''|'''''mm'''''|'''''E/W'''''|'''''[[#1|coordinate parameters]]'''''|'''''[[#2|template parameters]]'''''}}''' '''{{coord|'''''dd'''''|'''''mm'''''|'''''ss'''''|'''''N/S'''''|'''''dd'''''|'''''mm'''''|'''''ss'''''|'''''E/W'''''|'''''[[#1|coordinate parameters]]'''''|'''''[[#2|template parameters]]'''''}}''' The hemisphere identifiers (''N/S'') and (''E/W''), if used, must be adjacent to the enclosing pipe "'''|'''" characters, and cannot be preceded or succeeded by spaces. There are two kinds of parameters, all optional: *'''Coordinate parameters''' are parameters that {{tl|Coord}} passes to the map server. These have the format ''parameter:value'' and are separated from each other by the underscore character ( _ ). The supported coordinate parameters are ''dim:'', ''globe:'', ''region:'', ''scale:'', ''source:'', and ''type:''. See [[#Coordinate parameters|coordinate parameters]] for details and examples. *'''Template parameters''' are parameters used by the {{tl|Coord}} template. These have format ''parameter=value'' and are separated from each other by the pipe character ( | ). The supported template parameters are ''display='', ''format='', ''name='', and ''notes=''. :* '''display=''' can be one of the following: ::* display=inline â€“ Display the coordinate inline (default) ::* display=title â€“ Display the coordinate near the page title ::** shortcut: display=t ::* display=inline,title â€“ Display the coordinate both inline and at title ::** shortcut: display=it ::* display=title,inline has the same effect as display=inline,title ::Note: the title attribute indicates that the coordinates apply to the entire page, and not just one of (perhaps many) places mentioned in it — so it should only be omitted in the latter case. :* '''format=''' can be used to force ''dec'' or ''dms'' coordinate display. ::* format=dec reformats the coordinates to decimal degrees format. ::* format=dms reformats the coordinates to degrees | minutes | seconds format. :* '''name=''' can be used to annotate inline coordinates for display in map services such as the [[:meta:WikiMiniAtlas|WikiMiniAtlas]]. If omitted, the article title (PAGENAME) is assumed. ::Note: a ''name='' parameter causes {{tl|Coord}} to emit an [[w:hCard|hCard]] [[w:microformat|microformat]] using that name, ''even if used within an existing hCard''. Do not use when the name is that of a person (e.g for a gravesite), as the generated hCard would be invalid. Also, do not use square brackets in names. :* '''notes=''' specifies text to be displayed immediately following the coordinates. This is primarily intended for adding footnotes to title coordinates. == Examples == {| class="wikitable" | {{coord|43.651234|-79.383333}} | {{coord|43.651234|-79.383333}} | Toronto â€“ Fully decimal â€“ N & W |- | {{coord|43.65|-79.38}} | {{coord|43.65|-79.38}} | Toronto â€“ less precise |- | {{coord|43.6500|-79.3800}} | {{coord|43.6500|-79.3800}} | Toronto â€“ medium precision with trailing zeroes |- | {{coord|43.651234|N|79.383333|W}} | {{coord|43.651234|N|79.383333|W}} | Toronto â€“ decimal with Northing & Westing |- | {{coord|43|29|N|79|23|W}} | {{coord|43|29|N|79|23|W}} | Toronto â€“ degrees & minutes |- | {{coord|43|29|4|N|79|23|0|W}} | {{coord|43|29|4|N|79|23|0|W}} | Toronto â€“ degrees, minutes & seconds |- | {{coord|43|29|4.5|N|79|23|0.5|W}} | {{coord|43|29|4.5|N|79|23|0.5|W}} | Toronto â€“ degrees, minutes, seconds & fractions of seconds |- | {{coord|55.752222|N|37.615556|E}} | {{coord|55.752222|N|37.615556|E}} | Moscow â€“ N & E |- | {{coord|55.752222|N|37.615556|E|format=dms}} | {{coord|55.752222|N|37.615556|E|format=dms}} | Convert to dms format |- | {{coord|39.098095|-94.587307|format=dms}} | {{coord|39.098095|-94.587307|format=dms}} | Decimal conversion without N/S/E/W |- | {{coord|55.752222|N|37.615556|E|format=dec|name=Moscow}} | {{coord|55.752222|N|37.615556|E|format=dec|name=Moscow}} | Convert to decimal and label on some maps |- | {{coord|33|55|S|18|25|E}} | {{coord|33|55|S|18|25|E}} | Cape Town â€“ S & E |- | {{coord|35|00|N|105|00|E}} | {{coord|35|00|N|105|00|E}} | People's Republic of China |- | {{coord|22|54|30|S|43|14|37|W}} | {{coord|22|54|30|S|43|14|37|W}} | Rio â€“ S & W |- | {{coord|22|S|43|W}} | {{coord|22|S|43|W}} | A [[w:Degree Confluence Project|degree confluence]]. |- | {{coord|52|28|N|1|55|W|region:GB_type:city|notes={{cite web|url=http://www.fallingrain.com/world/UK/0/Birmingham.html|title=Birmingham}}|display=inline,title}} | {{coord|52|28|N|1|55|W|region:GB_type:city|notes={{cite web|url=http://www.fallingrain.com/world/UK/0/Birmingham.html|title=Birmingham}}|display=inline,title}} | Birmingham â€“ with display, notes, and parameter settings; note display also in title of this page. |} ===References=== {{reflist}} == Coordinate parameters == The first unnamed parameter following the longitude is an optional string of coordinate parameters, separated by underscores. These parameters help [[tswiki:GeoHack|GeoHack]] select suitable map resources, and they will become more important when [[m:Wikimaps|Wikimaps]] becomes fully functional. === type:''T'' === {{Coord-doc-type}} === scale:''N'' === {{Coord-doc-scale}} === dim:''D'' === {{Coord-doc-dim}} === region:''R'' === {{Coord-doc-region}} === globe:''G'' === {{Coord-doc-globe}} === source:''S'' === {{Coord-doc-source}} ==Per-user display customization== {{UF-coord-classes}} ==Internals== ===Subtemplates=== {{Coord/sub doc}} ===Class names=== The class names '''geo''', '''latitude''' and '''longitude''' are used to generate the microformat and '''MUST NOT''' be changed. [[Category:Coordinates templates|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{| class="wikitable {{{class|}}}" style="background:#f5fffa; {{{style|}}}" |- ! style="background:#cef2e0;"| {{{{{navbar|tnavbar-header}}}|1= {{{title|Quick how to}}} |2=Coord_how-to}} |- | To add {{Coord|57|18|22.5|N|4|27|32.7|W}} to the top of a page, use {{Tl|Coord}}, thus: :'''{{Coord|57|18|22.5|N|4|27|32.7|W|display=title}}''' These [[w:Geographic coordinate system|coordinates]] are in [[w:Degree (angle)|degrees]], [[w:Minute of arc|minutes]], and seconds of arc. |- | To add {{Coord|44.112|N|87.913|W}} to the top of a page, use either :'''{{Coord|44.112|N|87.913|W|display=title}}''' ''or'' :'''{{Coord|44.112|-87.913|display=title}}''' These coordinates are in [[w:Decimal fraction|decimal]] degrees. |- | * Degrees, minutes and seconds must be separated by [[w:Vertical bar|a pipe ("|")]]. * [[w:Geodetic system|Map datum]] must be WGS84 (except for off-earth bodies). * Avoid excessive precision (0.0001Â° is <11 m, 1â€³ is <31 m). * Latitude (N/S) must appear before longitude (E/W). |- |Optional coordinate parameters follow the longitude and are separated by [[w:Underscore|an underscore ("_")]]:
*[[Template:Coord#dim:D|dim]]: dim:'''''N''''' (viewing diameter in metres) *[[Template:Coord#region:R|region]]: region:'''''R''''' ([[w:ISO 3166-1 alpha-2|ISO 3166-1 alpha-2]] or [[w:ISO 3166-2|ISO 3166-2]] code) *[[Template:Coord#type:T|type]]: type:'''''T''''' (landmark or city(30,000), for example) Other optional parameters are separated by [[w:Vertical bar|a pipe ("|")]]:
*[[Template:Coord#Display|display]] *: {{Para|display|inline}} (the default) to display in the body of the page only, *: {{Para|display|title}} to display in the title only, or *: {{Para|display|inline,title}} to display in both places. *[[Template:Coord#Name|name]] *: name='''''X''''' to label the place on maps (default is [[mw:Help:Magic words#Page names|PAGENAME]]) Thus: '''{{Coord|44.117|-87.913|dim:30_region:US-WI_type:event''' ::'''|display=inline,title|name=accident site}}''' Use {{Para|display|title}} (or {{Para|display|inline,title}}) once per page, for the subject of the page, where appropriate. |- | * For full detail, refer to {{tl|Coord/doc}}. * Additional guidance is available: [[w:Wikipedia:Obtaining geographic coordinates|obtaining coordinates]], [[w:Geographic coordinate conversion|converting coordinates]] |} [[Category:Template namespace templates|{{PAGENAME}}]]

The following templates are "subroutines" of {{tl|Coord}}. Separating them out drastically reduces the pre-expand size of {{tl|Coord}}. They shouldn't be invoked directly. {| |- ! name ! function |- | {{tl|Coord/display/inline}} | displays coordinates inline |- | {{tl|Coord/display/inline,title}} | displays coordinates inline and above the page |- | {{tl|Coord/display/title}} | displays coordinates above the page (generally to the right of the page's title) |- | {{tl|Coord/link}} | generates microformats and link to [[tswiki:GeoHack|GeoHack]] |- | {{tl|Coord/input/dec}} | reads coordinates in decimal degrees <nowiki>{{coord|12|-12}}</nowiki> |- | {{tl|Coord/input/d}} | reads coordinates in decimal degrees with directional letters <nowiki>{{coord|12|N|12|W}}</nowiki> |- | {{tl|Coord/input/dm}} | reads coordinates in degrees/minutes format <nowiki>{{coord|12|12|N|12|12|W}}</nowiki> |- | {{tl|Coord/input/dms}} | reads coordinates in degrees/minutes/seconds format <nowiki>{{coord|12|12|12|N|12|12|12|W}}</nowiki> |- | {{tl|Coord/input/ERROR}} | generates error message if the inputs do not match any of the above formats |- | {{tl|Coord/input/error2}} | generates error message for range checks and such |- | {{tl|Coord/input/nolat}} | generates error message for missing latitude |- | {{tl|Coord/negzeropad}} | pads a positive number with trailing zeroes until it matches the precision of a negative number |- | {{tl|Coord/dec2dms}} | takes a decimal coordinate and two cardinal directions and renders a coordinate in degrees/minutes/seconds |- | {{tl|Coord/dms2dec}} | converts cardinal direction and degree/minutes/seconds to decimal coordinate |- | {{tl|Coord/prec dec}} | selects a format for converting decimal degrees, based on the precision of the inputs |}<noinclude>[[Category:Template namespace templates|{{PAGENAME}}]]</noinclude>

To always display coordinates as DMS values, add this to [[Special:Mypage/common.css|your common.css]]: :.geo-default { display: inline }
.geo-nondefault { display: inline }
.geo-dec { display: none }
.geo-dms { display: inline } To always display coordinates as decimal values, add this to [[Special:Mypage/common.css|your common.css]]: :.geo-default { display: inline }
.geo-nondefault { display: inline }
.geo-dec { display: inline }
.geo-dms { display: none } To display coordinates in both formats, add this to [[Special:Mypage/common.css|your common.css]]: :.geo-default { display: inline }
.geo-nondefault { display: inline }
.geo-dec { display: inline }
.geo-dms { display: inline }
.geo-multi-punct { display: inline } If CSS is disabled, or you have an old copy of [[MediaWiki:Common.css]] cached, you will see both formats. (You can either clear your cache or manually refresh this URL: [http://en.wikibooks.org/w/index.php?title=MediaWiki:Common.css&usemsgcache=yes&action=raw&ctype=text/css&smaxage=2678400].) To disable display of the blue globe adjacent to coordinates, add this to [[Special:Mypage/common.js|your common.js]] :var wma_settings = {enabled:false} Note that this will disable [[m:WikiMiniAtlas|WikiMiniAtlas]].[[Category:Template namespace templates|{{PAGENAME}}]]

The globe: parameter specifies the [[w:planet|planet]], [[w:dwarf planet|dwarf planet]], [[w:asteroid|asteroid]], or [[w:natural satellite|natural satellite]] upon which the coordinates reside. Apart from ''[[w:earth|earth]]'' (the default), recognized values are: ''[[w:Mercury (planet)|mercury]]'', ''[[w:venus|venus]]'', ''[[w:moon|moon]]'', ''[[w:mars|mars]]'', ''[[w:Phobos (moon)|phobos]]'', ''[[w:Deimos (moon)|deimos]]'', ''[[w:Ceres (dwarf planet)|ceres]]'', ''[[w:4 Vesta|vesta]]'', ''[[w:Ganymede (moon)|ganymede]]'', ''[[w:Callisto (moon)|callisto]]'', ''[[w:Io (moon)|io]]'', ''[[w:Europa (moon)|europa]]'', ''[[w:Mimas (moon)|mimas]]'', ''[[w:Enceladus (moon)|enceladus]]'', ''[[w:Tethys (moon)|tethys]]'', ''[[w:Dione (moon)|dione]]'', ''[[w:Rhea (moon)|rhea]]'', ''[[w:Titan (moon)|titan]]'', ''[[w:Hyperion (moon)|hyperion]]'', ''[[w:Iapetus (moon)|iapetus]]'', ''[[w:Phoebe (moon)|phoebe]]'', ''[[w:Miranda (moon)|miranda]]'', ''[[w:Ariel (moon)|ariel]]'', ''[[w:Umbriel (moon)|umbriel]]'', ''[[w:Titania (moon)|titania]]'', ''[[w:Oberon (moon)|oberon]]'', ''[[w:Triton (moon)|triton]]'', and ''[[w:pluto|pluto]]''. {| class="wikitable sortable" |+ Samples ! Subject ! G ! Markup ! Result |- | [[w:Kittu (crater)|Kittu Crater]] | ganymede | {{coord|0.4|N|334.6|W|globe:ganymede}} | {{coord|0.4|N|334.6|W|globe:ganymede}} |- | [[w:Viking 2|Viking 2]] lander | mars | {{coord|48.269|N|225.990|W|globe:mars}} | {{coord|48.269|N|225.990|W|globe:mars}} |- | [[w:Mozart (crater)|Mozart Crater]] | mercury | {{coord|8|N|190.5|W|globe:mercury}} | {{coord|8|N|190.5|W|globe:mercury}} |- | [[w:Apollo 11|Apollo 11]] lander | moon | {{coord|0|40|26.69|N|23|28|22.69|E|globe:moon}} | {{coord|0|40|26.69|N|23|28|22.69|E|globe:moon}} |- | [[w:Ksa (crater)|Ksa Crater]] | titan | {{coord|14.0|N|65.4|W|globe:titan}} | {{coord|14.0|N|65.4|W|globe:titan}} |- | [[w:Venera 13|Venera 13]] lander | venus | {{coord|7.5|S|303|E|globe:venus}} | {{coord|7.5|S|303|E|globe:venus}} |- | [[w:Stickney (crater)|Stickney Crater]] | phobos | {{coord|1|N|49|W|globe:phobos}} | {{coord|1|N|49|W|globe:phobos}} |} For globes other than Earth, {{tl|coord}} does not assume a specific reference system (in contrast with Earth's WGS84). Since the template defaults to east longitude, the |W| direction must be specified for globes that measure longitude westward. At the present time, only limited mapping is available for Mars and the Moon and none for other extraterrestrial bodies.[[Category:Template namespace templates|{{PAGENAME}}]]

The type: parameter specifies the type of location for reverse mapping (for instance, to select a marker icon in the [[m:WikiMiniAtlas|WikiMiniAtlas]]). It also sets the [[w:Scale (map)|map scale]], which can however be overridden by ''[[#dim:D|dim:]]'' or ''[[#scale:N|scale:]]''. Valid types are: {| class="wikitable" ! T ! Description ! Map scale |- | '''country''' | (e.g. "type:country") |style="text-align:right;" | 1:10,000,000 |- | '''satellite''' | geo-stationary satellites |style="text-align:right;" | 1:10,000,000 |- | '''adm1st''' | Administrative unit of country, 1st level (province, state), see [[w:Table of administrative divisions by country#Table|table]], e.g. [[w:U.S. state|U.S. state]]s |style="text-align:right;" | 1:1,000,000 |- | '''adm2nd''' | Administrative unit of country, 2nd level, see [[w:Table of administrative divisions by country#Table|table]], e.g. [[w:County (United States)|County]] |style="text-align:right;" | 1:300,000 |- | '''adm3rd''' | Administrative unit of country, 3rd level, see [[w:Table of administrative divisions by country#Table|table]] |style="text-align:right;" | 1:100,000 |- | '''city('''''pop''''')''' | cities, towns, villages, hamlets, suburbs, subdivisions, neighborhoods, and other human settlements (including unincorporated and/or abandoned ones) with known population
Please replace ''pop'' with a number. Commas in ''pop'' will be ignored. There should be no blanks. |style="text-align:right;" | 1:30,000 ... 1:300,000 |- | '''city''' | cities, towns, villages, hamlets, suburbs, subdivisions, neighborhoods, and other human settlements (including unincorporated and/or abandoned ones) with unspecified population
These are treated as minor cities. |style="text-align:right;" | 1:100,000 |- | '''airport''' | airports and airbases |style="text-align:right;" | 1:30,000 |- | '''mountain''' | peaks, mountain ranges, hills, submerged reefs, and seamounts |style="text-align:right;" | 1:100,000 |- | '''isle''' | islands and isles |style="text-align:right;" | 1:100,000 |- | '''waterbody''' | bays, fjords, lakes, reservoirs, ponds, lochs, loughs, meres, lagoons, estuaries, inland seas, and waterfalls |style="text-align:right;" | 1:100,000 |- | '''forest''' | forests and woodlands |style="text-align:right;" | 1:50,000 |- | '''river''' | rivers, canals, creeks, brooks, and streams, including intermittent ones |style="text-align:right;" | 1:100,000 |- | '''glacier''' | glaciers and icecaps |style="text-align:right;" | 1:50,000 |- | '''event''' | one-time or regular events and incidents that occurred at a specific location, including battles, earthquakes, festivals, and shipwrecks |style="text-align:right;" | 1:50,000 |- | '''edu''' | schools, colleges, and universities |style="text-align:right;" | 1:10,000 |- | '''pass''' | mountain passes |style="text-align:right;" | 1:10,000 |- | '''railwaystation''' | stations, stops, and maintenance areas of railways and trains, including railroad, metro, rapid transit, underground, subway, elevated railway, etc. |style="text-align:right;" | 1:10,000 |- | '''landmark''' | buildings (including churches, factories, museums, theatres, and power plants but excluding schools and railway stations), caves, cemeteries, cultural landmarks, geologic faults, headlands, intersections, mines, ranches, roads, structures (including antennas, bridges, castles, dams, lighthouses, monuments, and stadiums), tourist attractions, valleys, and other points of interest |style="text-align:right;" | 1:10,000 |- | | ''Default scale: if no type is used or the type is not defined in the geohack extension'' |style="text-align:right;" | 1:300,000 |} {| class="wikitable" |+ Samples ! T ! Markup ! Result |- | '''waterbody''' | {{coord|46|43|N|7|58|E|type:waterbody}} | {{coord|46|43|N|7|58|E|type:waterbody}} |}[[Category:Template namespace templates|{{PAGENAME}}]]

The region: parameter specifies the political region for terrestrial coordinates. It is used to select appropriate map resources. If no region: parameter is provided, [[tswiki:GeoHack|GeoHack]] attempts to determine the region from the coordinates. The region should be supplied as either a two character [[w:ISO 3166-1 alpha-2|ISO 3166-1 alpha-2]] country code or an [[w:ISO 3166-2|ISO 3166-2]] region code. Examples of [[w:ISO 3166-1 alpha-2|ISO 3166-1 alpha-2]] codes: {{columns-list|2;width:50%| * '''AQ''' [[w:Antarctica|Antarctica]] * '''AU''' [[w:Australia|Australia]] * '''BR''' [[w:Brazil|Brazil]] * '''CA''' [[w:Canada|Canada]] * '''CH''' [[w:Switzerland|Switzerland]] * '''DE''' [[w:Germany|Germany]] * '''FR''' [[w:France|France]] * '''GB''' [[w:United Kingdom|United Kingdom]] * '''HK''' [[w:Hong Kong|Hong Kong]] * '''IN''' [[w:India|India]] * '''JP''' [[w:Japan|Japan]] * '''LK''' [[w:Sri Lanka|Sri Lanka]] * '''NL''' [[w:Netherlands|Netherlands]] * '''NZ''' [[w:New Zealand|New Zealand]] * '''RU''' [[w:Russia|Russia]] * '''US''' [[w:United States|United States]]}} Examples of [[w:ISO 3166-2|ISO 3166-2]] codes: * '''NO-03''' [[w:Oslo|Oslo]], [[w:Norway|Norway]] * '''DE-TH''' [[w:Thuringia|Thuringia]] * '''US-NY''' [[w:New York|New York state]] The oceans have the following Wiki assigned code elements: * '''XN''' Arctic Ocean * '''XA''' Atlantic Ocean * '''XI''' Indian Ocean * '''XP''' Pacific Ocean * '''XS''' Southern Ocean In addition, two Wiki assigned code elements can be used with {{tl|coord}}: * '''XZ''' for objects in or above international waters (similar to [[w:UN/LOCODE|UN/LOCODE]]). * '''ZZ''' for use in examples. {| class="wikitable" cellpadding="20" |+ Samples ! Focus region ! Region ! Markup ! Result |- | Switzerland | CH |  {{coord|46.9524|N|7.4396|E|region:CH}}  | {{coord|46.9524|N|7.4396|E|region:CH}} |- | Berlin, Germany | DE-BE |  {{coord|52.5164|N|13.3775|E|region:DE-BE}}  | {{coord|52.5164|N|13.3775|E|region:DE-BE}} |}[[Category:Template namespace templates|{{PAGENAME}}]]

The scale: parameter specifies the desired [[w:scale (map)|map scale]] as 1:''N'', overriding the scale implied by any [[#type:T|type:]] parameter. [[tswiki:GeoHack|GeoHack]] uses scale: to select a map scale for a 72 [[w:Dots per inch|dpi]] computer monitor. If no dim:, type:, or scale: parameters are provided, GeoHack uses its default scale of 1:300,000. {| class="wikitable" |+ Samples ! Subject ! Scale ! Markup ! Result |- |[[w:Big Ben|Big Ben]] |style="text-align:right;"|1:500 |{{coord|51.500611|N|0.124611|W|scale:500}} |{{coord|51.500611|N|0.124611|W|scale:500}} |- |[[w:Palace of Westminster|Palace of Westminster]] |style="text-align:right;"|1:5,000 |{{coord|51.5006|N|0.1246|W|scale:5000}} |{{coord|51.5006|N|0.1246|W|scale:5000}} |- |[[w:City of Westminster|City of Westminster]] |style="text-align:right;"|1:50,000 |{{coord|51.501|N|0.125|W|scale:50000}} |{{coord|51.501|N|0.125|W|scale:50000}} |- |[[w:Greater London|Greater London]] |style="text-align:right;"|1:500,000 |{{coord|51.50|N|0.12|W|scale:500000}} |{{coord|51.50|N|0.12|W|scale:500000}} |}[[Category:Template namespace templates|{{PAGENAME}}]]

Specifies, where present, the data source and data source format/datum, and optionally the original data, presented in parentheses. This is initially primarily intended for use by geotagging robots, so that data is not blindly repeatedly copied from format to format and Wikibooks to Wikibooks, with progressive loss of precision and attributability.
Examples: * A lat/long geotag derived from a [[w:Ordnance Survey|Ordnance Survey]] [[w:British national grid reference system|National Grid Reference]] NM 435 355 found in the English-language Wikibooks would be tagged as "source:enwikibooks-osgb36(NM435355)" * A latitude-longitude location sourced from data taken from the German-language Wikibooks would be tagged as "source:dewikibooks" â€“ and so on, for other language codes; * A location sourced from the public domain [[w:GEOnet Names Server|GeoNet Names Server]] database would be tagged as "source:GNS". No datum or format information is needed, since by default all Wikibooks coordinates are in latitude/longitude format based on the [[w:World Geodetic System|WGS84]] datum. Similarly, US locations sourced from the similar public domain [[w:Geographic Names Information System|GNIS]] database would be tagged as "source:GNIS".<noinclude>[[Category:Template namespace templates|{{PAGENAME}}]]</noinclude>

The dim: parameter defines the [[w:diameter|diameter]] of a viewing circle centered on the coordinate. While the default unit of measurement is meters, the km suffix may be appended to indicate kilometers. [[tswiki:GeoHack|GeoHack]] uses dim: to select a [[w:Scale (map)|map scale]] such that the viewing circle appears roughly {{convert|10|cm|in|0}} in diameter on a 72 [[w:Dots per inch|dpi]] computer monitor. If no dim:, type:, or scale: parameters are provided, GeoHack uses its default viewing circle of {{convert|30|km|mi}}. {| class="wikitable" |+ Samples ! Subject ! View diameter ! Markup ! Result |- | [[w:Western Hemisphere|Western Hemisphere]] |style="text-align:right;"| {{convert|10000|km|mi}} | {{coord|0|N|90|W|dim:10000km}} | {{coord|0|N|90|W|dim:10000km}} |- | [[w:Ohio|Ohio]] |style="text-align:right;"| {{convert|400|km|mi}} | {{coord|40.5|-82.5|dim:400km}} | {{coord|40.5|-82.5|dim:400km}} |- | [[w:Dresden|Dresden]] |style="text-align:right;"| {{convert|20000|m|mi}} | {{coord|51.033|13.73|dim:20000}} | {{coord|51.033|13.73|dim:20000}} |- | [[w:Statue of Liberty|Statue of Liberty]] |style="text-align:right;"| {{convert|100|m|ft}} | {{coord|40.6892|-74.0445|dim:100}} | {{coord|40.6892|-74.0445|dim:100}} |- |}[[Category:Template namespace templates|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{documentation subpage}} This template, {{tl|Coord/link}}, is used by {{tl|Coord}}. === Examples ===
{{coord|10|N|30|W}}{{coord|10|N|30|W}}
{{coord|10|11|N|30|31|W}}{{coord|10|11|N|30|31|W}}
{{coord|10|11|12|N|30|31|32|W}}{{coord|10|11|12|N|30|31|32|W}}
=== Notes on classes=== Note: the span classes "geo-default", "geo-dec", and "geo-dms" are defined at [[MediaWiki:Common.css]]. In addition, "geo" and the nested "latitude" and "longitude" have special meaning as a [[w:Geo (microformat)|Geo microformat]] and so might also be used by other templates; see also http://microformats.org/wiki/geo. === Display === {{UF-coord-classes}} [[Category:Template subpages|{{PAGENAME}}]]
